New Records: Shivam Dube hit an unbeaten 60 as India defeated Afghanistan by six wickets in the first T20I in Mohali on Thursday.
Key Match Events: Axar Patel and Mukesh Kumar bagged two wickets each to help India restrict Afghanistan to 158/5 in 20 overs.
Tilak Varma c Gulbadin Naib b Azmatullah Omarzai 26 (22)
Jitesh Sharma c Ibrahim Zadran b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 31 (20)
Mohammad Nabi c Singh b Mukesh Kumar 42 (27)
Shivam Dube gets to his fifty in 38 balls.
Shivam Dube hit an unbeaten 60 as India defeated Afghanistan by six wickets in the first T20I in Mohali on Thursday.
Pre-Game Insights: India skipper Rohit Sharma has won the toss and opted to bowl first against Afghanistan on his T20I return after a gap of 14 months in the format.
Yashasvi Jaiswal is unavailable for selection for the first T20I due to a sore right groin.
No Kuldeep Yadav either. Just two regular pacers in Arshdeep and Mukesh. Shivam Dube might chip in if there is movement for the pacers.
Post-Match Reflections: A run-chase that got underway with a horrible mix-up, resulting in Rohit Sharma's run out, India scampered home with 15 balls to spare.
Miscellaneous Highlights: 28 runs off the last two over sees Afghanistan post a challenging 158/5 in a chilly Mohali night.
The pair added 68 runs for the fourth wicket before Mukesh dismissed both in the same over.
India win by 15 balls to spare, thanks to Shivam Dube's unbeaten 60.
Others: Rohit Sharma run out (Ibrahim Zadran/Rahmanullah Gurbaz) 0 (2)
Shubman Gill st Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 23 (12)
The pitch too has some moisture.
We are halfway into the Indian innings!
